metadata.Title: CVE-2022-44640 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heimdal before 7.7.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code because of an invalid free in the ASN.1 codec used by the Key Distribution Center (KDC).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-kcm - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-kdc - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-multidev - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-servers - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libasn1-8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libgssapi3-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhcrypto4-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhdb9-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libheimbase1-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libheimntlm0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3

No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream Samba, this vulnerability doesn't actually affect Samba, but the code has been patched in case the API is used in the future. See the following post: https://bugzilla.samba.org/show_bug.cgi?id=14929#c15

criterions.comment: heimdal package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3').
